member.name: ColorAdjustType
member.summary: The ColorAdjustType enumeration specifies which GDI+ objects use color-adjustment information. You can adjust the colors in a rendered image by passing the address of anImageAttributes object to the method. AnImageAttributes object maintains color and grayscale settings for five adjustment categories: default, bitmap, brush, pen, and text. Several of the methods of theImageAttributes class receive an element of the ColorAdjustType enumeration to specify the adjustment category.

member.name: ColorAdjustType.ColorAdjustTypeDefault
member.summary: Specifies that color or grayscale adjustment applies to all categories that do not have adjustment settings of their own.

member.name: ColorAdjustType.ColorAdjustTypeBitmap
member.summary: Specifies that color or grayscale adjustment applies to bitmapped images.

member.name: ColorAdjustType.ColorAdjustTypeBrush
member.summary: Specifies that color or grayscale adjustment applies to brush operations in metafiles.

member.name: ColorAdjustType.ColorAdjustTypePen
member.summary: Specifies that color or grayscale adjustment applies to pen operations in metafiles.

member.name: ColorAdjustType.ColorAdjustTypeText
member.summary: Specifies that color or grayscale adjustment applies to text drawn in metafiles.

member.name: ColorAdjustType.ColorAdjustTypeCount
member.summary: Used internally to record the number of color adjustment types.
